comments: phosphor-regulators configuration for IBM Everest systems
VDD, VIO, VCS Phase current limit updates
VCS Phase ISENIN protection enabled and set
all loops, min PWM pulse width = 40ns
Don't use tabs in comments, JSON doesn't like it!
Rule to set PMBus PAGE to 0
Rule to set PMBus PAGE to 1
Rule to set OPERATION to PMBus in control
Rule to set OPERATION to AVS in control
Rule to set common settings in all IR35219 devices
Rule to set common settings in all IR35220 (all VRMs)
Rule to set common settings in all TDA38740 (all VRMs)
Careful, this should only contain updates for
registers that are common between silicon revisions
Rule to determine if TDA38740 in B11 revision
This will use the secondary I2C interface
so be sure to set_device before and after
Rule to determine if TDA38740 in C11 revision
This will use the secondary I2C interface
so be sure to set_device before and after
Rule to configure a VDD rail using the PMBus
Rule to configure a VCS rail using the PMBus
Rule to configure a VDN rail using the PMBus
Rule to configure a VIO rail using the PMBus
Rule to configure a 3V3IO rail using the PMBus
IMPORTANT NOTE: 3V3IO reports half the actual
this is due to an component errata issue
VOUT_DROOP = 1.016mOhm >> was left incorrect from Vendor ATE
Rule to configure a 3V3CS rail using the PMBus
IMPORTANT NOTE: 3V3CS reports half the actual
this is due to an component errata issue
Rule to configure a AVDD rail using the PMBus
Rule to configure a VPCIe rail using the PMBus
Rule to configure a 1V1CS rail using the PMBus
Rule to configure a 5V0USB rail using the PMBus
These rules check for both the respective DCM presence
and VRM FRU presnce.  If either is present, the VRM
should be configured.  Both should be present together
Rule to determine if VRM@C12 should be configured.
Rule to determine if VRM@C13 should be configured.
Rule to determine if VRM@C15 should be configured.
Rule to determine if VRM@C18 should be configured.
Rule to determine if VRM@C20 should be configured.
Rule to determine if VRM@C21 should be configured.
Rule to determine if VRM@C54 should be configured.
Rule to determine if VRM@C55 should be configured.
Rule to determine if VRM@57 should be configured.
Rule to determine if DCM1 is present.
Rule to determine if DCM2 is present.
Rule to determine if DCM3 is present.
id format is   DCM<0|1|2|3> <location code> <domain name> [p<chip#>]
The DCM specified does not necessarily mean that the
domain service that DCM.  Instead it implies that
the domain is on a VRM physically neighboring that DCM
The first device in every FRU grouping will be the GPIO expander
